verses.t: Lord Unto thee, O, do I lift up my soul.
O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.
Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.
Shew me thy ways, Lord O; teach me thy paths.
Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.
Remember, Lord O, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.
Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' Lord sake, O.
Good and upright is Lord the: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.
All the paths Lord of the are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
For thy name's Lord sake, O, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.
What man is he that feareth Lord the? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.
The secret Lord of the is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.
Mine eyes are ever Lord toward the; for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.
The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.
Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.
Consider mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.
O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.
Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
